answers.answer: PENN,GOOD TO HEAR FROM YOU AND SORRY TO HEAR ABOUT THE DX OF DIABETES,I DON'T GET TO THE FORUMS LIKE I WISH I COULD.AS FOR THE GREYNESS OF VISION,CONTACT YOUR EYE DR..I HAVE VISUAL DISTORTION,USUALLY THE VISION IN MY LEFT EYE IS GREY OR FOGGY.THIS IS FROM MY REOCCURRING OPTICAL NEURTIS.LET YOUR DRS. KNOW WHAT YOUR EXPERIENCING.HUGST-LYNN

I get the grey filmy thing over my eye/eyes at times...been to a Neuro Optho and he quickly said it's not ON... I don't even remember him testing me for it..he just looked in the back of my eyes with a lite...??  no drops or machine of any kind?that was a few years ago...and my eyes are alot worse now then before... I would let your Dr know your having this problem and track how often it happens...OKtake carewobblyundx
I do not see the eye doc till late January. Not sure if I should try to move it sooner??? It wasn't so bad today - did yours come and go or just grey all the time?Penn

question: Does anyone else have part (sometimes most) of a page or computer screen appear grey? I am ahving this issue at present, but have had it happen before during my "episodes". I do have blurry vision still from recent onset of diabetes, but this does not seem related - plus it occurred before when my blood sugar was testing perfectly normal.Any clues? ThanksPenn
title: Probably asked this before, but...
